channel.title: Added anim to arms now what?
channel.description:
[IMG]http://i477.photobucket.com/albums/rr135/zaradomin/elitearms.jpg[/img]
if u look closely u can see the other set of arms from all the numbers
i used mr potato heads tut or dragmagic tut on adding anim
now what do i do?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 18, 2009, 08:57:56 pm[/size][hr]any help?

item.title: Added anim to arms now what?
item.dc:creator: @recker450 recker450
item.description:
@recker450 wrote:

can u tell me the things for arms but with pics like the one with platebody or a link to pics?

Read full topic
item.source: Added anim to arms now what?

item.title: Added anim to arms now what?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

skittle - make sure your not in basic mode (main menu -> file -> basic mode)
Then on the tabs on the left, click the command tab, then click the wgt button. click a vertex(point) and either enter a number and click ok or drag your mouse with the button still down.
You can also select lots of things before clicking the wgt button and then enter the number, click ok and every vertex you selected will have that number attatched.
If you can’t see any points, click the pt button just above the left hand side of the 3D window. A point is a vertex.

Read full topic

item.source: Added anim to arms now what?

item.title: Added anim to arms now what?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Are you sure you followed the tutorial correctly?
The PRI: is made by painting, if they are all 10 then they should all be the same colour.
The TSKIN: is also made by painting, it would look like the colored arms above, different colours for different areas.
The VSKIN1: is made by adding weights, you can’t actually see them, only if you turn vertex skins on in datmaker, and then they appear as numbers.
The VSKIN1: is the ‘animation’ as some people call it. These numbers are used by the animation method to decide which parts get rotated. These are why your arms are going everywhere

the basic weights are :-

left elbow = 23
right elbow = 17
left shoulder = 25
left below shoulder to elbow 24
right shoulder 21
right below shoulder to elbow 18
left below elbow to wrist 22
right below elbow to wrist 19
left hand 28
right hand 27

just remember this isn’t the full set of weights you can use for arms…it’s just a basic list to help you out.

P.S in datmaker, it’s right mouse button to zoom in and out, SHIFT+left button to pan. Might make your screenshots a bit better.

Read full topic

item.source: Added anim to arms now what?

item.title: Added anim to arms now what?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Arms is pri = 10.
You can add it in metasequoia or in datmaker if they are all they same.

For the animation (ie VSKIN1:), use similar ones to the model.
Only viewing one set of data at a time might help.
You’ll see a pattern if you look at sevel different sets of arms.

Read full topic

item.title: Added anim to arms now what?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

What you mean - now what?

If that’s a metasequoia file, then click make dat button, then refresh and test the dat.
If thats the dat, then add it to client and test.
